item.title: Sejourne 表示，欧盟计划于 12 月发布公告，以提高小型电动汽车的价格
item.description: 欧盟一位委员周二表示，欧盟委员会的目标是在12月宣布建立一个新的经济型小型电动汽车类别，以应对中国的竞争并重振欧洲市场。【原文：The European Commission aims to announce the creation of a new category of affordable small electric cars in December in an effort to counter Chinese competition and revive the European market, an EU commissioner said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 星巴克押宝本地专业技术，有助于在中国市场重振雄风
item.description: 星巴克周一决定将其中国业务最多 60% 的股份出售给本地私募股权公司博裕资本，这将有助于这个处境艰难的品牌在全球增长最快的咖啡市场之一重新站稳脚跟。【原文：Starbucks' decision on Monday to sell up to 60% of its China business to local private equity firm Boyu Capital could help the hard-pressed brand regain ground in one of the world’s fastest-growing coffee markets.】

item.title: 美国银行业监管机构称合并 "有价值"，承诺快速审查
item.description: 一位美国最高银行监管机构负责人周二表示，该机构致力于及时审查潜在的银行兼并，并补充说此类交易可能对金融体系 "相当有价值"。【原文：A top U.S. bank regulator said Tuesday that his agency is committed to promptly reviewing potential bank mergers, adding that such deals could be "quite valuable" to the financial system.】

item.title: Perplexity 因代理人工智能购物工具受到亚马逊的法律威胁
item.description: Perplexity AI 公司周二表示，它已收到亚马逊公司的法律威胁，要求这家初创公司阻止其 Comet 浏览器上的人工智能代理代表用户在这家电子商务巨头的平台上购物。【原文：Perplexity AI said on Tuesday it has received a legal threat from Amazon.com demanding that the startup block the AI agent on its Comet browser from shopping on the e-commerce giant's platform on a user's behalf.】

item.title: 贝塔技术公司估值 74 亿美元，纽交所首秀股价平开
item.description: 电动飞机制造商贝塔科技公司（Beta Technologies）周二在纽约证券交易所首次上市时股价平开，估值为 74.4 亿美元，表明投资者对美国政府长期停摆持谨慎态度。【原文：Electric aircraft maker Beta Technologies was valued at $7.44 billion after its shares opened flat in their New York Stock Exchange debut on Tuesday, signaling investor caution over a prolonged U.S. government shutdown.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，IBM 将裁员数千人，专注于软件发展
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二报道，IBM 将在本季度裁员数千人，同时继续将业务重心转向高增长的软件和服务。【原文：IBM will cut thousands of roles this quarter while it continues to shift the focus of its business to higher-growth software and services, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 华尔街为纽约市市长投票做好准备，州长竞选让人看到中期选举的可能性
item.description: 本周二将举行纽约市市长选举，华尔街人心惶惶，如果佐赫兰-马姆达尼（Zohran Mamdani）可能获胜，必将在全球资本主义的心脏地带引起反响，金融家们担心纽约市的持久竞争力和吸引力。【原文：Wall Street is on edge heading into the New York City mayoral election on Tuesday, with a potential victory for Zohran Mamdani set to reverberate through the heart of global capitalism, where financiers worry about the city's lasting competitiveness and appeal.】

item.title: 联合利华预计在 12 月 6 日前完成 Magnum 冰淇淋的分拆工作
item.description: 消费品集团联合利华（Unilever）周二表示，在因美国政府停摆而推迟分拆后，预计将在 12 月 6 日前完成分拆旗下 Magnum 冰淇淋部门的工作。【原文：Consumer goods group Unilever said on Tuesday it expects to complete the spin-off of its Magnum Ice Cream unit, after a delay because of the U.S. government shutdown, by December 6.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称，阿波罗撤回以每股 64 美元的价格将比萨连锁店 Papa John's 私有化的申请
item.description: 据两位熟悉该交易的人士透露，阿波罗全球公司（Apollo Global）已经撤回了以每股 64 美元的价格将披萨连锁店 Papa John's 私有化的提议，因为华尔街正在等待周四发布的一份预计会很难看的财报。【原文：Apollo Global has withdrawn its offer to take pizza chain Papa John’s private at $64 a share, according to two people familiar with the deal, as Wall Street waits to see what is expected to be a tough earnings report on Thursday.】

item.title: 法国法院调查 TikTok 推动自杀的算法
item.description: 法国司法当局周二表示，他们已对中国社交媒体平台 TikTok 及其算法可能导致年轻人自杀的风险展开调查。【原文：French judicial authorities said on Tuesday they had opened an investigation into Chinese social media platform TikTok and the risks of its algorithms pushing young people into suicide.】

item.title: Meta 拒绝接受法国权利监督机构对算法的裁决
item.description: Meta Platforms 周二拒绝了法国权利监督机构针对其社交网络 Facebook 上歧视性招聘广告的算法做出的裁决。【原文：Meta Platforms on Tuesday rejected a ruling by the French rights watchdog against its algorithm after allegations of discriminatory job advertisements on its social network Facebook.】

item.title: 美国航空公司裁减部分管理人员和辅助人员职位
item.description: 美国航空公司周二表示，作为员工队伍调整的一部分，该公司将裁撤少量管理和辅助人员职位。【原文：American Airlines said on Tuesday it was eliminating a small number of management and support staff positions as part of a workforce adjustment.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，苹果公司将推出经济型 Mac，进军低成本笔记本电脑市场
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二报道，苹果公司准备在明年上半年推出一款经济型 Mac，首次进入低成本笔记本电脑市场。【原文：Apple is preparing to launch a budget Mac in the first half of next year, entering the low-cost laptop market for the first time, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 文件显示，杰弗里-爱泼斯坦在高盛和汇丰银行有账户
item.description: 新的法庭文件显示，已故金融家和性犯罪者杰弗里-爱泼斯坦（Jeffrey Epstein）在高盛、汇丰银行和其他银行都有账户。【原文：Jeffrey Epstein, the disgraced late financier and sex offender, had accounts at Goldman Sachs , HSBC and other banks, new court filings show.】

item.title: 电动汽车补贴到期，美国 10 月汽车销量下降
item.description: 由于联邦政府补贴的到期削弱了对电池驱动的电动汽车的需求，10 月份美国轻型汽车的销量出现下滑，而劳动力市场的宽松和关税带来的价格上涨可能会限制今年的反弹。【原文：Sales of U.S. light vehicles fell in October as the expiration of federal government subsidies undercut demand for battery-powered electric cars, and an easing labor market and looming higher prices from tariffs could limit any rebound this year.】

item.title: 独家：英国石油公司如何赢得对 Venture Global 的 10 多亿美元诉讼案
item.description: 五位接近此事的消息人士称，石油巨头英国石油公司（BP）以美国公司的不公平行为为由，赢得了对液化天然气生产商 Venture Global 的 10 多亿美元仲裁案，这为索赔人在平行案件中可能使用的策略提供了启示。【原文：Oil major BP won its $1 billion-plus arbitration case against liquefied natural gas producer Venture Global with an argument of unfair behaviour by the U.S. company, said five sources close to the matter, shedding light on strategy that could be used by claimants in parallel cases.】

item.title: 特拉华州法官认为目前没有必要将辉瑞与诺和诺德之间的美塞拉竞购战诉诸法庭
item.description: 特拉华州一名法官在周二举行的紧急听证会上说，目前没有必要让法院批准辉瑞公司的请求，让其介入与诺和诺德公司的 Metsera 竞购战。【原文：There is currently no need for a court to grant Pfizer's request to get involved in its bidding war with Novo Nordisk for Metsera , a Delaware judge said at an emergency hearing on Tuesday.】

item.title: 加州锂业公司着眼于 2026 年上市，吸引美国政府投资
item.description: 加利福尼亚州的一家锂公司计划明年首次公开募股，以争取成为美国联邦政府有吸引力的投资目标。【原文：A California lithium company plans to launch an initial public offering next year as part of a bid to become an attractive investment target for the U.S. federal government.】

item.title: 巴西总统卢拉表示，如果谈判不能尽快取得进展，他将再次致电特朗普
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）周二表示，如果两国之间的会谈在巴西本月主办的联合国气候大会 COP30 结束前仍无进展，他将再次致电美国总统唐纳德-特朗普。【原文：Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva said on Tuesday he will call his U.S. counterpart Donald Trump again if talks between their countries do not progress by the end of COP30, the United Nations climate conference Brazil is hosting this month.】

item.title: 美国银行监管机构希望确保大银行废除 "去银行化 "政策
item.description: 美国一位资深银行监管者周二表示，他希望确保大型银行摒弃以前可能导致某些行业或客户 "去银行化 "的政策。【原文：A senior U.S. bank regulator said Tuesday that he is looking to ensure that large banks have abandoned previous policies that may have contributed to "debanking" of certain industries or clients.】

item.title: 独家报道致客户的信显示，Nexperia无法确定 "是否以及何时 "向中国部门发送芯片
item.description: 荷兰芯片制造商 Nexperia 在致客户的一封信中表示，由于正在研究中国是否会放宽对全球供应链的出口管制，该公司无法透露何时恢复从其位于中国东莞的工厂发货，也无法保证发货质量。【原文：Dutch chipmaker Nexperia cannot say when deliveries from its site in Dongguan, China, will resume or guarantee quality of shipments, according to a letter to customers, as it looks into whether China will ease export controls weighing on global supply chains.】

item.title: 美国法官裁定，"智能橱窗 "制造商 View 前首席财务官必须面对美国证券交易委员会的起诉
item.description: 联邦法官裁定，View 公司前首席财务官必须面对美国证券交易委员会的指控，即他因疏忽而允许这家 "智能窗户 "制造商低报更换有缺陷窗户的成本。【原文：The former chief financial officer of View must face U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission claims he negligently allowed the maker of "smart windows" to understate the cost of replacing defective windows, a federal judge ruled.】

item.title: IHeartMedia 股价因有关 Netflix 授权谈判的报道而创下两年新高
item.description: 本周二，iHeartMedia 的股价创下两年多来的新高，因为彭博新闻社报道称 Netflix 正在洽谈授权这家广播和播客公司发行视频播客。【原文：Shares of iHeartMedia hit their highest in more than two years on Tuesday after Bloomberg News reported that Netflix was in talks to license video podcasts distributed by the radio and podcasting firm.】

item.title: 关税动荡刺激经纪需求，物流公司 Expeditors 公布乐观业绩
item.description: 本周二，全球货运代理公司 Expeditors International of Washington 公布的第三季度利润和收入均高于华尔街预期，主要原因是空运量强劲以及对其报关服务的需求增加。【原文：Global freight forwarder Expeditors International of Washington reported third-quarter profit and revenue above Wall Street estimates on Tuesday, driven by strong airfreight volumes and increased demand for its customs brokerage services.】

item.title: 维多利亚的秘密面临来自 Brett Blundy 的 BBRC 的新压力，要求更换董事会
item.description: 内衣制造商维多利亚的秘密的大股东 BBRC International 周二要求罢免董事长唐娜-詹姆斯（Donna James）的职务，并要求为其创始人布雷特-布兰迪（Brett Blundy）提供一个董事会席位。【原文：Lingerie maker Victoria's Secret's major shareholder, BBRC International, on Tuesday called for the removal of Chair Donna James and requested a board seat for its founder Brett Blundy.】

item.title: 欧盟认为有时间和空间找到内克佩里亚解决方案，并避免最坏情况发生
item.description: 欧盟委员会周二表示，它欢迎行业迹象表明中国已与欧盟公司接触，以恢复部分芯片的流通，从而防止出现最坏的情况，并为找到持久的解决方案创造时间和空间。【原文：The European Commission said on Tuesday it welcomed industry indications that China had engaged with EU companies to restore partial flow of chips, preventing a worst-case scenario and creating time and space to find a lasting solution.】

item.title: 竞购战升温，诺和诺德、辉瑞出价更高
item.description: 肥胖症药物开发商诺和诺德（Novo Nordisk）和辉瑞（Pfizer）周二表示，已经修改了对美塞拉（Metsera）的出价。【原文：Novo Nordisk and Pfizer have revised their bids for Metsera , the obesity drug developer said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 欧盟立法者就特朗普关税协议的日落条款和条件展开辩论
item.description: 欧洲议会周二开始就是否将欧盟与美国的关税协议作为华盛顿让步的条件和时间限制进行辩论，这可能会重燃与特朗普政府的贸易紧张关系。【原文：The European Parliament began debating on Tuesday whether to make the EU-U.S. tariff deal conditional on concessions from Washington and limited in time, which could reignite trade tensions with the Trump administration.】

item.title: 工业集装箱公司 TriMas 将以 14.5 亿美元的价格剥离航空航天部门
item.description: 工业集装箱制造商 TriMas 公司周二表示，将以 14.5 亿美元的价格向投资公司 Tinicum 的关联公司出售其航空航天部门。【原文：TriMas Corp is selling its aerospace segment to an affiliate of investment firm Tinicum for $1.45 billion, the industrial container maker said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 法拉利将在美国销售的部分车型的价格涨幅限制在 5%以内
item.description: 法拉利发言人告诉路透社，在达成降低欧洲产品进口关税的协议后，法拉利已将其在美国销售的部分车型的价格涨幅缩减至最多 5%。【原文：Ferrari has trimmed price increases on some of the models it sells in the U.S. to a maximum of 5% following a deal to reduce the import tariff on European products, a spokesman told Reuters.】
